column2: Perhaps you do not know it, but the monkeys think that all the bananas belong to them.

column2: When Brazilian children eat bananas they say, "I am a monkey." I once knew a little boy in Brazil who was very, very fond of bananas.

column2: This is the story they tell to show us how it all came about.

column2: Once upon a time when the world had just been made and there was only one kind of banana, but very many kinds of monkeys, there was a little old woman who had a big garden full of banana trees.

column2: It was very difficult for the old woman to gather the bananas herself, so she made a bargain with the largest monkey.
column3: It was very difficult for the old woman to gather the bananas herself, so she made a bargain with the largest monkey.

column2: She told him that if he would gather the bunches of bananas for her she would give him half of them. The monkey gathered the bananas.

column2: O, peddler boy, peddler boy, he said to him, "please give me a banana." The image of wax answered never a word.
